AD_BhaalCultist02.synopsis: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_CraneumRat_02.synopsis: A Cranium Rat is spying around in the city and feeding information back to the Brain.
AD_CraneumRat_02.how_to_trigger: Go to CTY_Main_A, click on the rat S_LOW_Sewers_CraniumRat_001

AD_FireWizard.synopsis: The firewizard talks to himself and his elementals during his idle.
AD_FireWizard.how_to_trigger: load up CTY_Main_Ateleport to -86; 19; 842observe the firewizard form a dianstance as he is talking to himslef (location: -117; 22; 836)

FireWizard.synopsis: The Fire Wizard interrupts the combat to shout crazy profanities at you. You can take the opportunity to convince him to stop fighting, or you can continue to fight.
FireWizard.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ago to -303; 24; 116start going up the path, fighting through the elmentalsonce you are spotted by the wizard, he will start the dialog

AD_Refugee01.synopsis: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

Refugee01.synopsis: One-liner for refugees in the sewers, while getting shot at by Bhaal cultists.
Refugee01.how_to_trigger: Ensure you are in a deal with OrinLoad up CTY_Main_AGo to -20; 18; 789Click on |Refugee| - S_LOW_Refugee01 - b79264f9-cbd0-4cbc-a5de-6c33ed5c2c19

AD_Bhaalist01OrinAppeased.synopsis: Interactive dialogue with Bhaal cultist in the sewers. If player has made a deal with Orin, they get invited to join in. They can side with cultists, be neutral, or side against cultists. If they side against cultists, they break their pact with Orin.
AD_Bhaalist01OrinAppeased.how_to_trigger: Make sure you have an agreement with Orin (it is not currently implemented) and go to -25; 22; 806 and click on Death's Head of Bhaal - S_LOW_Bhaalist01 336fe388-afbe-4b9b-a86e-aec927658019.

Penitent.synopsis: The player meets a mute trader in the sewers.
Penitent.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ago to -100; 15; 766click on the Voiceless Penitent

Bhaalist01.synopsis: Interactive dialogue with Bhaal cultist in the sewers. If player has made a deal with Orin, they get invited to join in. They can side with cultists, be neutral, or side against cultists. If they side against cultists, they break their pact with Orin.
Bhaalist01.how_to_trigger: Make sure you have an agreement with Orin (it is not currently implemented) and go to -25; 22; 806 and click on Death's Head of Bhaal - S_LOW_Bhaalist01 336fe388-afbe-4b9b-a86e-aec927658019.

AD_MephitsBickering01.synopsis: Two grease mephits on watch are bickering.
AD_MephitsBickering01.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ago to 222; 16; 324Wach the mephits from a distance.

Bhaalist02.synopsis: One-liner for Bhaal cultist in the sewers. Reacts to whether or not you are allied with Orin.
Bhaalist02.how_to_trigger: Make sure you have an agreement with Orin (it is not currently implemented) and go to -25; 22; 806 and click on Night Blade - S_LOW_Bhaalist02 - a8f0d3b8-2b55-4f1e-acf7-ef2767544d8a

AD_MephitsBickering02.synopsis: Two grease mephits on watch are chatting back and forth. They're impish and none too bright.
AD_MephitsBickering02.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ago to 222; 16; 324Wach the mephits from a distance.

AD_SkullActivating.synopsis: An AD indicating that the Forsaken skull is about to summon the Ghost that haunts the player if the player carries it. This only plays the first time the skull enters the player's ownership.
AD_SkullActivating.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -100; 16; 766talk to the Voiceless Penitentstart trading with himbuy the skullwalk away from him

VampireBoyfriendLady.synopsis: The player meets a lady waiting for her Vampire Boyfriend. The player can persuade her to leave.
VampireBoyfriendLady.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -134; 14; 876Click on Lorna Esthelian

AD_Refugee02.synopsis: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

Refugee02.synopsis: One-liner for refugees in the sewers, while getting shot at by Bhaal cultists.
Refugee02.how_to_trigger: Ensure you are in a deal with OrinLoad up CTY_Main_AGo to -20; 18; 789Click on |Refugee| - S_LOW_Refugee02 267decbc-7902-4e60-bb35-1fe4b6929bf4

Bhaalist03.synopsis: One-liner for Bhaal cultist in the sewers. Reacts to whether or not you are allied with Orin.
Bhaalist03.how_to_trigger: Make sure you have an agreement with Orin (it is not currently implemented) and go to -25; 22; 806 and click on Night Blade - S_LOW_Bhaalist03 - abce7142-0fad-4801-8d34-4bfeffec23da

AD_Combat_FireWizard.synopsis: The crazed Fire wizard in the sewers shouts these ADs during combat.
AD_Combat_FireWizard.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Ago to -121; 22; 832get into combat with the wizard, and observe the combat ADs.

AD_RefugeesFleeing.synopsis: The refugees make a run for it, when the bhaal cultists are defeated and they have a chance to run away.
AD_RefugeesFleeing.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -27; 22; 804 defeat all the bhaal cultistsOne of the refugees will say this as they run away.

Bhaalist04.synopsis: One-liner for Bhaal cultist in the sewers. Reacts to whether or not you are allied with Orin.
Bhaalist04.how_to_trigger: Make sure you have an agreement with Orin (it is not currently implemented) and go to -25; 22; 806 and click on Night Blade - S_LOW_Bhaalist04 - 42bbff34-15a2-4802-a6de-262ef040aa9f

Refugee05.synopsis: One-liner for refugees in the sewers, while getting shot at by Bhaal cultists.
Refugee05.how_to_trigger: Ensure you are in a deal with OrinLoad up CTY_Main_AGo to -20; 18; 789Click on |Refugee| - S_LOW_Refugee05 - c41b89e7-b720-4aeb-a266-89715c00e433

AD_BhaalCultist01.synopsis: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

Dead_FireWizard.synopsis: Speak with dead with the Fire Wizard in the Sewers. He was pursued by the Absolutist and flead to the sewers for safety. We can hint at the position of the Abandoned Cistern and Minsc in there too.
Dead_FireWizard.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -121; 22; 832Kill the Fire Wizardcast speak with dead on his corpse (with a character that isn't the killer)

AD_CraneumRat_01.synopsis: A Cranium Rat is spying around in the city and feeding information back to the Brain.
AD_CraneumRat_01.how_to_trigger: Go to CTY_Main_A, click on the rat S_LOW_Sewers_CraniumRat_000

AD_GurHunterAndKids.synopsis: Gur Hunter and his kids in the Sewers. They're struggling to come to terms with the fact that his children have been turned into vampire spawn.

AD_BhaalCultist02_0.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
AD_BhaalCultist02_0.text: Try running - please. It's so much more fun.
AD_BhaalCultist02_0.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist02_1.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
AD_BhaalCultist02_1.text: You wail like pigs - why shouldn't we stick you like pigs?
AD_BhaalCultist02_1.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist02_2.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
AD_BhaalCultist02_2.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist02_3.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
AD_BhaalCultist02_3.text: Don't you know there are monsters down here?
AD_BhaalCultist02_3.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_FireWizard_0.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_FireWizard_0.text: Sarin's soul will not be slave to any god - Absolute or otherwise!

AD_FireWizard_1.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_FireWizard_1.text: Hush, Cousin. Of course you're my favourite. But I made the others from your mass - so they are my favourite too.
AD_FireWizard_1.context: NodeContext: As if soothing a sensitive child

AD_FireWizard_2.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_FireWizard_2.text: QUIET, COUSINS! We will show Sarin proper respect.
AD_FireWizard_2.context: NodeContext: Rage-filled shout at first, contrasting with quiet reasonable tone on second sentence.

FireWizard_10.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_10.text: Sarin is... silent, now. I think. At rest.

FireWizard_19.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_19.text: What's this, Cousin? Another Absolutist come to see what we did to poor old Sarin?

FireWizard_39.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_39.text: Your god took her mind, cultist. So Bareki took her head, and I burned the flesh from her bones.

FireWizard_4.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_4.text: And now you come to interrupt the funeral rites? I -

FireWizard_29.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_29.text: Cousin says we will take you in return. He says you look just like kindling for Sarin's funeral pyre.

FireWizard_9.speaker: Player
FireWizard_9.text: You have it wrong. I'm not with the Absolute!

FireWizard_17.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_17.text: Hah. I believe you may believe that. The Absolute takes people, twists them...

FireWizard_12.speaker: Player
FireWizard_12.text: And 'Cousin' looks like he fell out of an aboleth's arse. Are you sure you're related?

FireWizard_36.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_36.text: He is... clan. Summoned in place of the friends that I lost.

FireWizard_20.speaker: Player
FireWizard_20.text: I haven't got the slightest idea who or what you're talking about.

FireWizard_22.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_22.text: Of course you don't. Sarin, Bareki, and I made our coin by going unnoticed. The finest thieves in the city - until we messed with Gortash and he sent the cult after us.

FireWizard_37.speaker: Player
FireWizard_37.text: Wait. No need for violence. Just tell me what happened to your friend.

FireWizard_62.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_62.text: I took my friend's life - but only after your god took her soul.

FireWizard_5.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_5.text: Sarin, Bareki, and I - we were the three finest thieves in Baldur's Gate. We broke into the offices of Gortash. Discovered he was with the Absolute too.

FireWizard_44.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_44.text: Your fellow cultists hunted us so we hid down here. We were safe - and so was our loot - until the darkness soured Sarin's mind. She kept our treasure from us, said Bareki and I had gone strange.

FireWizard_61.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_61.text: HUSH, COUSIN! Sarin turned into a cultist herself. So we did what we had to. Bareki wept until his voice was gone - and then he was gone, too.

FireWizard_31.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_31.text: Leaving only me to conduct Sarin's rites. And my cousins, here - you cannot conduct the rites without a clan to bear witness. Or some fuel for the fire.

FireWizard_23.speaker: Player
FireWizard_23.text: My people know this rite - Ixinloex, the 'Burning of the Dead'. There can be no bloodshed here.

FireWizard_16.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_16.text: ...You're right. It must be a cleansing fire. A pure one. I took Sarin's life - I must be sure she does not lose her soul, as well.

FireWizard_15.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_15.text: Pass, then - and do NOT come BACK. This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.

FireWizard_35.speaker: Player
FireWizard_35.text: Your paranoia already killed Sarin. Are you so keen to follow her?

FireWizard_52.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_52.text: I... cannot. I am the last of us left to do the rites. I must do the rites.

FireWizard_30.speaker: Player
FireWizard_30.text: I'm not a cultist. And I don't think your friend was, either. Your paranoia turned you against one another.

FireWizard_25.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_25.text: She swore she was no cultist, but you all lie - the Absolute turns you...

FireWizard_60.speaker: Player
FireWizard_60.text: If you're a thief, then you answer to Nine-Fingers. We're allies.

FireWizard_57.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_57.text: You serve the guildmaster...? Then you cannot be with the cult. Or... perhaps she is.

FireWizard_0.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_0.text: I don't know. I don't know! Pass, then - and do NOT come BACK. This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.

FireWizard_63.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_63.text: NO NO NO! You are so deep in the Absolute's power, you do not even know it yourself. Just like Sarin!

FireWizard_27.speaker: Player
FireWizard_27.text: You need witnesses - I'm a witness. Just here to pay my respects.

FireWizard_14.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_14.text: ...Good. That is good. She deserves... more than me.

FireWizard_1.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_1.text: Pay your respects as you pass, then - and do NOT come BACK.

FireWizard_59.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_59.text: This is Sarin's final resting place - and a killing ground for all who come to disturb her.

FireWizard_48.speaker: Player
FireWizard_48.text: I'm sworn to a better god than the Absolute. Why not let me say a prayer?

FireWizard_46.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_46.text: Say your words as you pass, then, priest. And do NOT come BACK.

FireWizard_2.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_2.text: NO! Enough of the gods and their meddling - she will be PURE!

FireWizard_38.speaker: Player
FireWizard_38.text: Go on, then. Let's find out whose flame is bigger.

FireWizard_53.speaker: Player
FireWizard_53.text: Mephits and grease. Press me, and you might see some real magic.

FireWizard_21.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
FireWizard_21.text: Perhaps Bareki will find me again. His jokes were much better than Cousin's.

AD_Refugee01_0.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
AD_Refugee01_0.text: We just needed somewhere to rest - please!
AD_Refugee01_0.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

AD_Refugee01_1.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
AD_Refugee01_1.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

AD_Refugee01_2.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
AD_Refugee01_2.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

AD_Refugee01_3.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
AD_Refugee01_3.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

Refugee01_0.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
Refugee01_0.text: Stop - stop shooting! We haven't done anything!
Refugee01_0.context: NodeContext: cultists on the other side of the sewer are shooting at refugges. Cowering, yelling in fear and anger. Pinned down.

Refugee01_1.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
Refugee01_1.context: NodeContext: cultists on the other side of the sewer are shooting at refugges. Cowering, yelling in fear and anger. Pinned down.

AD_Bhaalist01OrinAppeased_0.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
AD_Bhaalist01OrinAppeased_0.text: You serve the Dread Lord well. Lady Orin's favour is well placed.

Penitent_7.speaker: Narrator
Penitent_7.text: *The penitent looks at you silently. Expectantly.*

Penitent_0.speaker: Narrator
Penitent_0.text: *The penitent doesn't respond, holding your gaze almost unblinkingly with his.*

Penitent_4.speaker: Player
Penitent_4.text: You're running a shop here, are you?

Penitent_2.speaker: Narrator
Penitent_2.text: *There is the slightest flicker of acknowledgement in his eyes.*

Penitent_5.speaker: Narrator
Penitent_5.text: *The penitent blinks - you think. You are dismissed.*

Bhaalist01_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_4.text: Halt - this one is an ally of our Lady in Red.
Bhaalist01_4.context: NodeContext: addressing the other cultists. 'the blessed one' refers to the player here.

Bhaalist01_16.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_16.text: Orin spoke of you - you walk in the Dread Lord's favour. Perhaps you wish to partake in his service.
Bhaalist01_16.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'service' refers to slaughtering refugees

Bhaalist01_11.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_11.text: Go ahead. Their blood is yours to spill.
Bhaalist01_11.context: NodeContext: 'Their' refers to the refugees being tormented

Bhaalist01_13.speaker: Player
Bhaalist01_13.text: Do as invited - attack the refugees.

Bhaalist01_9.speaker: Player
Bhaalist01_9.text: Carry on without me. I need my weapons sharp for other business.

Bhaalist01_10.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_10.text: As you wish. Bhaal's blessings upon you.

Bhaalist01_7.speaker: Player
Bhaalist01_7.text: I will not slaughter these people. I will free them from your tyranny.

Bhaalist01_17.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_17.text: Heretic! You act against Orin, you act against Bhaal. And our lord has no mercy for sinners.

Bhaalist01_5.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_5.text: What's this? A heretic in our midst? Your death, in the Dread Lord's name.

Bhaalist01_12.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_12.text: Your bloody trail returns you to us. Will you partake now?

Bhaalist01_15.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
Bhaalist01_15.text: You serve the Dread Lord well. Lady Orin's favour is well placed.

AD_MephitsBickering01_0.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_0.text: What's the name of that river down there?
AD_MephitsBickering01_0.context: NodeContext: Curious, stupid. talking about a flowing sewer - genuinely thinks it's a river.

AD_MephitsBickering01_2.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_2.context: NodeContext: 'SOO-ERR' is an exaggerated pronunciation of sewer - he thinks it's the name of an impressive river

AD_MephitsBickering01_1.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_1.text: Whatever it's called, it's impressive. And it tastes great.
AD_MephitsBickering01_1.context: NodeContext: talking about a mighty river (actually a sewer) that he's impressed by

AD_MephitsBickering01_7.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_7.text: I keep forgetting. What are we supposed to be doing?
AD_MephitsBickering01_7.context: NodeContext: confused - has a short attention span

AD_MephitsBickering01_6.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_6.text: Wizard told us to watch for troublemakers.
AD_MephitsBickering01_6.context: NodeContext: irritated, had to remind about this instruction a LOT already today

AD_MephitsBickering01_4.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_4.context: NodeContext: a bit whiney - confused as to how he can look out for 'troublemakers' when he is one

AD_MephitsBickering01_3.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_3.text: Shut up and keep your mucky little peep-holes peeled.
AD_MephitsBickering01_3.context: NodeContext: irritated - 'peep-holes' being eyes. Mucky because these creatures are made of a muck-like substance.

AD_MephitsBickering01_9.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_9.text: Did you go for a swim earlier?
AD_MephitsBickering01_9.context: NodeContext: curious, talking to a friend

AD_MephitsBickering01_5.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_5.text: Nah. Don't know how to swim.

AD_MephitsBickering01_8.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering01_8.text: Huh. Must have been some other oozing, stinking lump floating downstream.
AD_MephitsBickering01_8.context: NodeContext: mistook a friend for an 'oozing, stinking lump' in the sewers. Not meant as an insult - just a casual observation.

Bhaalist02_0.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
Bhaalist02_0.text: It is but Lady Orin's word that keeps my arrows from your chest.

Bhaalist02_1.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
Bhaalist02_1.text: You serve the Dread Lord well. Orin's faith in you is well-earned.

Bhaalist02_2.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
Bhaalist02_2.text: Step away, lest I forget my pledge to Lady Orin not to put an arrow in you.

Bhaalist02_3.speaker: Night Blade Kryss
Bhaalist02_3.text: You do not belong here, heretic. Your death has been ordained.

AD_MephitsBickering02_8.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_8.text: They do it when they're... sad?
AD_MephitsBickering02_8.context: NodeContext: Losing confidence in his knowledge - humans are weird

AD_MephitsBickering02_4.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_4.text: Oh, just shut up and let the wizard leak.
AD_MephitsBickering02_4.context: NodeContext: Given up trying to explain / doesn't know

AD_MephitsBickering02_10.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_10.text: Oh, my slippery arse. I just realised where we are.
AD_MephitsBickering02_10.context: NodeContext: 'my slippery arse' is an oath, like 'Jesus Christ'. Realizing where they are, none too pleased

AD_MephitsBickering02_5.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_5.context: NodeContext: As if it's terrible terrible news

AD_MephitsBickering02_3.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_3.context: NodeContext: Disgusted - wants to go back to its elemental plane of grease

AD_MephitsBickering02_12.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_12.text: When's the wizard gonna do something? Last master let me poison a well.

AD_MephitsBickering02_6.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_6.text: This is it. We're doing a vigil, it said. For its friend.
AD_MephitsBickering02_6.context: NodeContext: Doesn't know what a vigil or a friend is, really

AD_MephitsBickering02_11.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_11.text: That stack of bones up there? That was its friend? So... I shouldn't have had a nibble?
AD_MephitsBickering02_11.context: NodeContext: 'Uh-oh - I've been eating that corpse'

AD_MephitsBickering02_13.speaker: Grease Mephit
AD_MephitsBickering02_13.text: Eh. No, it's fine, I think? Friends nibble their friends.
AD_MephitsBickering02_13.context: NodeContext: Doesn't know if it's OK to eat a corpse they're supposed to be honouring, but masking ignorance. 'Sure, sure, I'm sure it's fine'

AD_SkullActivating_0.speaker: Player
AD_SkullActivating_0.text: That skull - something's happening to it.

VampireBoyfriendLady_10.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_10.text: I'm sure he'll turn up eventually - just wish there was somewhere to sit down that wasn't... sticky.

VampireBoyfriendLady_27.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_27.text: Ah - a friendly face at last. Are you going to the party as well?

VampireBoyfriendLady_43.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_43.text: I know. Bit strange, isn't it? But then you have to be open to trying new things.

VampireBoyfriendLady_39.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_39.text: The venue's called 'The Palace'. Not sure what it stands for, but it sounds very exclusive.

VampireBoyfriendLady_54.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_54.text: Which party is that? I get so many invitations...

VampireBoyfriendLady_20.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_20.text: I don't know if I should say - it's very exclusive...

VampireBoyfriendLady_18.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_18.text: Oh, go on, then. I'll tell you. It's an underground party. At a place called 'The Palace'.

VampireBoyfriendLady_25.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_25.text: My date's supposed to meet me here, but there's no sign of him.

VampireBoyfriendLady_30.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_30.text: You haven't seen him, have you? Pale, skinny - extremely piercing eyes.

VampireBoyfriendLady_52.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_52.text: Looks a bit like you, actually.

VampireBoyfriendLady_34.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_34.text: Looks a bit like your friend here.

VampireBoyfriendLady_51.speaker: Astarion
VampireBoyfriendLady_51.text: Oh dear. I assure you it's not.

VampireBoyfriendLady_31.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_31.text: It's funny. He was ever so keen for me to come. He didn't seem the type to cancel...

VampireBoyfriendLady_0.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_0.text: Normal. Mostly. Didn't have much of an appetite at dinner, though he said he was saving himself for tonight.
VampireBoyfriendLady_0.context: NodeContext: Hesitating, having second thoughts now she looks back on events

VampireBoyfriendLady_29.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_29.text: He was so enthusiastic. I don't understand why he hasn't shown up...

VampireBoyfriendLady_48.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_48.text: You've had a very lucky escape. Your date was a vampire.

VampireBoyfriendLady_5.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_5.text: A vampire?! No... he wasn't... was he?

VampireBoyfriendLady_60.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_60.text: But then... why am I still here? He could have had me by the neck any time he liked...

VampireBoyfriendLady_32.speaker: Astarion
VampireBoyfriendLady_32.text: Mother may I. I'm positively starved.

VampireBoyfriendLady_14.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_14.text: You think something's happened to him?

VampireBoyfriendLady_4.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_4.text: He did seem quite interested in my collar bones... I thought that was just his 'thing', if you catch my drift.
VampireBoyfriendLady_4.context: NodeContext: Uncertain, seeing things in a new light

VampireBoyfriendLady_28.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_28.text: You know what - I might give this party a miss. Plenty more fish in the Chionthar, as they say.
VampireBoyfriendLady_28.context: NodeContext: Nervous - realised she needs to get out of here

VampireBoyfriendLady_63.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_63.text: If you see him, don't tell him I was here. Just tell him I, erm, I wasn't ready to be in a relationship. I'm sure he'll understand.

VampireBoyfriendLady_55.speaker: Astarion
VampireBoyfriendLady_55.text: I'd imagine so - there's no way he'd leave someone as appetising as you alone.

VampireBoyfriendLady_9.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_9.text: You're right. I'm sure he was perfectly safe.

VampireBoyfriendLady_45.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_45.text: I'll be honest with you - he could turn out to be a worg in a skin suit, and it still wouldn't be the worst date I've had.

VampireBoyfriendLady_42.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_42.text: I'll give him a while longer. Maybe he's just washing his hair...

VampireBoyfriendLady_40.speaker: Astarion
VampireBoyfriendLady_40.text: I'm sure that's what he's doing...
VampireBoyfriendLady_40.context: NodeContext: sarcastic, he's definitely not just washing his hair

VampireBoyfriendLady_37.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_37.text: I'd cut your losses if I were you.

VampireBoyfriendLady_61.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_61.text: You're right. Just look at me - up to my ankles in filth, waiting for a man with a collarbone fetish. I deserve better!

VampireBoyfriendLady_46.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_46.text: Was there anything else unique about this date of yours?

VampireBoyfriendLady_56.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_56.text: Now you mention it, he brought his own wine with him to the Mermaid last night. Strange smell it had, kind of metallic...
VampireBoyfriendLady_56.context: NodeContext: Starts off gossipping, then realises what he was really drinking (blood)

VampireBoyfriendLady_26.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_26.text: I'm sure he'll show up eventually.

VampireBoyfriendLady_24.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_24.text: I bloody hope so - my feet are getting soaked with gods know what. This party had better be worth it.

VampireBoyfriendLady_47.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_47.text: I'm sure he'll show up eventually.

VampireBoyfriendLady_44.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_44.text: Did he say what kind of party it's supposed to be?

VampireBoyfriendLady_62.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_62.text: Only that it was him and a few of his closest friends. Said he couldn't wait to introduce me to them - how often does a man say that to a girl he's only met once?

VampireBoyfriendLady_35.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_35.text: Now that you mention it, he didn't eat much at dinner last night. Didn't eat anything at all - just pushed the food round his plate.

VampireBoyfriendLady_58.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_58.text: I know the Mermaid's food's an acquired taste, but you'd think he'd at least have tried it... I bet he was nervous. He seemed really keen.

VampireBoyfriendLady_23.speaker: Narrator
VampireBoyfriendLady_23.text: *The individual descriptions could refer to many things, but taken together, she can only be referring to something vampiric in nature.*

VampireBoyfriendLady_36.speaker: Player
VampireBoyfriendLady_36.text: I very much doubt you're going where I'm going.

VampireBoyfriendLady_50.speaker: Lorna Esthelian
VampireBoyfriendLady_50.text: Ah, of course. The party's a secret - don't worry, I'm in the know.
VampireBoyfriendLady_50.context: NodeContext: verbal equivalent of a knowing tap on the nose

AD_Refugee02_0.speaker: Refugee Khathi
AD_Refugee02_0.text: Just let us go - we won't come back!
AD_Refugee02_0.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

AD_Refugee02_1.speaker: Refugee Khathi
AD_Refugee02_1.text: Ilmater's hand, keep us from harm...
AD_Refugee02_1.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists. This version's a quiet, desperate prayer

AD_Refugee02_2.speaker: Refugee Khathi
AD_Refugee02_2.text: We didn't know anyone was here, we're sorry!
AD_Refugee02_2.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

AD_Refugee02_3.speaker: Refugee Khathi
AD_Refugee02_3.context: NodeContext: A refugee screaming for help and mercy while being shot at by Bhaal cultists.

Refugee02_1.speaker: Refugee Khathi
Refugee02_1.text: Help me, oh gods, please. I don't want to die.
Refugee02_1.context: NodeContext: cutlists on the other side of the sewer are firing shots at the refugees. Has just seen their friends die, freaking out as more shots are incoming.

Bhaalist03_0.speaker: Night Blade Dogaletto
Bhaalist03_0.text: Bhaal shows us the way. We are but blades for the execution of his will.

Bhaalist03_1.speaker: Night Blade Dogaletto
Bhaalist03_1.text: It takes a sharp weapon to kill, but a sharper mind to make a slaughter fit for Bhaal. I am pleased that you have both.

Bhaalist03_2.speaker: Night Blade Dogaletto
Bhaalist03_2.text: What you must have done to win Bhaal's blessings from Lady Orin... I quiver to think of such violence.

Bhaalist03_3.speaker: Night Blade Dogaletto
Bhaalist03_3.text: This was your final blunder. Bhaal bays for your blood.

AD_Combat_FireWizard_0.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_Combat_FireWizard_0.context: NodeContext: Crazed, defiant - you won't be taken by this new god

AD_Combat_FireWizard_1.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_Combat_FireWizard_1.text: You won't have me! Not like Sarin! NOT LIKE HER!
AD_Combat_FireWizard_1.context: NodeContext: Crazed, defiant - you won't be taken by this new god

AD_Combat_FireWizard_2.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_Combat_FireWizard_2.context: NodeContext: Crazed, surprised and launching fireballs

AD_Combat_FireWizard_3.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
AD_Combat_FireWizard_3.text: Burn them burn them BURN THEM TO BE SURE!
AD_Combat_FireWizard_3.context: NodeContext: Crazed - the Absolute can control people so you'll burn anyone who comes against you

AD_RefugeesFleeing_0.speaker: Refugee Sconnor
AD_RefugeesFleeing_0.text: Go! We won't get another chance!
AD_RefugeesFleeing_0.context: NodeContext: Frantic, fleeing combat while the player has the enemy distracted.

Bhaalist04_0.speaker: Night Blade Phylle
Bhaalist04_0.text: Such slaughter. Such annihilation. The Murder Lord's thirst is well-quenched today.

Bhaalist04_1.speaker: Night Blade Phylle
Bhaalist04_1.text: Your service is welcome here, favoured of Orin, for there is no end to the Murder Lord's thirst.

Bhaalist04_2.speaker: Night Blade Phylle
Bhaalist04_2.text: What's this? A meek one, ready for the slaughter. In Bhaal's name.
Bhaalist04_2.context: NodeContext: 'A meek one' refers to the player having snuck up to this cultist

Bhaalist04_3.speaker: Night Blade Phylle
Bhaalist04_3.text: There is butchery aplenty for all of Bhaal's servants.

Refugee05_0.speaker: Refugee Pharbz
Refugee05_0.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain, clutching whatever is injured

Refugee05_1.speaker: Refugee Pharbz
Refugee05_1.text: Get back! The cultists - argh. They've shot half of us!
Refugee05_1.context: NodeContext: clutching somewhere (anywhere) as if he's been shot/injured. Scared and terrified as he's been shot at from the opposing of a sewer.

AD_BhaalCultist01_0.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
AD_BhaalCultist01_0.text: That one was close. Can you feel our lord's breath on your neck?
AD_BhaalCultist01_0.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist01_1.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
AD_BhaalCultist01_1.text: Is your little life really worth so much to you? We offer Bhaal's blessing!
AD_BhaalCultist01_1.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist01_2.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
AD_BhaalCultist01_2.text: Some little lambs have strayed from the flock!
AD_BhaalCultist01_2.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

AD_BhaalCultist01_3.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Blythe
AD_BhaalCultist01_3.text: The more you wriggle, the longer this will take!
AD_BhaalCultist01_3.context: NodeContext: Bhaal cultist shouts these ADs while shooting at refugees in the Sewers.

Dead_FireWizard_18.speaker: Narrator
Dead_FireWizard_18.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_FireWizard_23.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
Dead_FireWizard_23.text: Sarin... Bareki... me... no better... thieves...

Dead_FireWizard_21.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
Dead_FireWizard_21.text: Said I lost... my mind... then lost... his voice...

Dead_FireWizard_16.speaker: Aelis Siryasius
Dead_FireWizard_16.text: Cult... took Sarin's mind... so we... took her head...

Dead_FireWizard_5.speaker: Player
Dead_FireWizard_5.text: Did Sarin have a parasite in her head? A tadpole?

Dead_FireWizard_3.speaker: Narrator
Dead_FireWizard_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Dead_FireWizard_1.speaker: Player
Dead_FireWizard_1.text: What were you doing down here?

Dead_FireWizard_24.speaker: Narrator
Dead_FireWizard_24.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_FireWizard_25.speaker: Narrator
Dead_FireWizard_25.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_GurHunterAndKids_3.speaker: Kass
AD_GurHunterAndKids_3.text: I'm so hungry, father. I've never been so hungry.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_8.speaker: Gandrel
AD_GurHunterAndKids_8.text: We will find a way to help you. To control this.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_6.speaker: Chessa
AD_GurHunterAndKids_6.text: It hurts. And it's getting worse.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_5.speaker: Gandrel
AD_GurHunterAndKids_5.text: There must be a way to undo this. There must be something.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_4.speaker: Chessa
AD_GurHunterAndKids_4.text: I just don't want to feel like this anymore.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_9.speaker: Gandrel
AD_GurHunterAndKids_9.text: You are my children - you are strong enough to fight this.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_1.speaker: Chessa
AD_GurHunterAndKids_1.text: I'll try. I don't want to be a monster.

AD_GurHunterAndKids_10.speaker: Chessa
AD_GurHunterAndKids_10.text: Promise you won't let us hurt anyone?

AD_GurHunterAndKids_7.speaker: Gandrel
AD_GurHunterAndKids_7.text: You could never hurt an innocent, my child.
